com.isoterik.mgdx

Class SceneManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.isoterik.mgdx.SceneManager

  • public final class SceneManager
extends java.lang.Object
    A SceneManager manages the scenes in a game. It maintains a stack of stackable scenes that can be revisited using revertToPreviousScene(ISceneTransition). Scenes can be transitioned immediately or using a ISceneTransition to animate the transition.

    • Method Detail

      • __init

        public static void __init()
        Initializes the manager. DO NOT CALL THIS METHOD!

      • instance

        public static SceneManager instance()
        Returns:
        a reference to the singleton instance

      • setCurrentScene

        public void setCurrentScene(Scene scene)
        Make the given scene the current scene displayed without any transition animation.
        Parameters:
        scene - the scene to transition to.

      • setCurrentScene

        public void setCurrentScene(Scene scene,
                            ISceneTransition sceneTransition)
        Make the given the scene the current scene displayed. The transition is animated if a non-null ISceneTransition is given.
        Parameters:
        scene - the scene to transition to.
        sceneTransition - a scene transition to animate the transition with. Can be null

      • __render

        public void __render()
        Called when the game needs to render. Frame rate is capped at 60 frames per second. DO NOT CALL THIS METHOD!

      • __pause

        public void __pause()
        Called when the game should pause. DO NOT CALL THIS METHOD!

      • __resize

        public void __resize(int width,
                     int height)
        Called when the screen is resized. DO NOT CALL THIS METHOD!
        Parameters:
        width - the new width
        height - the new height

      • __resume

        public void __resume()
        Called when the game should resume. DO NOT CALL THIS METHOD!

      • __dispose

        public void __dispose()
        Called when the game is getting destroyed. DO NOT CALL THIS METHOD!

      • getPreviousScene

        public Scene getPreviousScene()
        Returns:
        the previous scene. null if there is no previous scene.

      • getCurrentScene

        public Scene getCurrentScene()
        Returns:
        the current scene. null if there is no current scene.

      • revertToPreviousScene

        public void revertToPreviousScene(ISceneTransition transition)
        Reverts to the previous scene. Note: Only stackable scenes can be reverted to.
        Parameters:
        transition - a transition animation to use. can be null

      • revertToPreviousScene

        public void revertToPreviousScene()
        Reverts to the previous scene.

      • pushScene

        protected void pushScene(Scene scene)
        Adds a scene to the stack
        Parameters:
        scene - a scene to add

      • popScene

        protected Scene popScene()
        Returns:
        a scene removed from the bottom of the stack

      • canRevertToPreviousScene

        public boolean canRevertToPreviousScene()
        Returns:
        whether it's possible to revert to a previous scene
